content: easy dishcloth / facecloth this is a super easy super quick pattern to make a very handy dishcloth facecloth cleaning cloth whatever you need you will need yarn preferably cotton in dk weight but not essential hook 4 00mm or 4 50mm recommended scissors darning needle stitches used chain chain treble_crochet treble_crochet front post treble_crochet fptr half treble_crochet half_double_crochet size guide approximate 4 50mm hook and dk yarn finished size 24cm x 26cm this also has a lot of stretch because of the larger hook size 4 00mm hook and dk yarn finished size 21cm x 22cm this is more tightly worked so not as much stretch and will retain shape better the size of hook and type of yarn is entirely up to you 1 pattern 1 chain 41 in 3rd chain from hook work 1tr and 1tr into each chain along 39tr chain 1 turn 2 work 1tr into the very 1st stitch then fptr around the next stitch repeat sequence 1tr 1fptr until only 1 stitch remains work 1tr into the final stitch chain 1 turn these photos are just a guide to show you where your first stitch on each row should go as well as what your stitches should look like the third photo shows where to put your hook when working a front post treble_crochet fptr 3 -21 repeat row 2 chain 1 turn 22 work 1htr into each stitch along here you have 2 options you can fasten_off after row 22 sew in ends and you re done your final piece should look like the 1st photo or you can choose to add a border which neatens up the edges and gives it a more finished look no border border 2 border the border is simply a row of half_double_crochet around the edges of the cloth begin where you left off after row 22 with yarn and hook still attached hopefully and chain 2 then 1htr into that same spot then going down the side of your work work 1htr at regular intervals along the edge i recommend trying to fit 2 half_double_crochet at the edge of each treble_crochet stitch so once you are at the bottom you should have 44 half_double_crochet here you can see how i have worked the half_double_crochet down the edges of the row of treble_crochet the space between the arrows is 2 row of treble_crochet and you can see i have worked 4 half_double_crochet into that space when you are at the corner work 2htr chain 1 2htr into the corner stitch here you can see how the corner stitch works then work 1htr into each stitch along the bottom 2htr chain1 2htr into the corner then 1htr up the other side 2htr chain 1 2htr into the corner then 1htr across the top work 2htr into the final stitch chain 1 and join with a slip_stitch to the top of the chain 2 fasten_off and weave in ends 3
